value.title: Pentagon aims to spread artificial intelligence services
value.excerpt: After spending the past few years demonstrating how artificial intelligence tools can boost U.S. military efforts, the office responsible for overseeing such programs at the Defense Department is shifting its focus to helping military services and agencies figure out how to incorporate the technologies in their systems.

value.title: Artificial Intelligence: MIT creates ‘liquid’ machine learning - ‘future of robot control'
value.excerpt: ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE (AI) engineers have designed a new ‘liquid' machine-learning system potentially capable of revolutionising everything from autonomous cars to medical diagnosis.

value.title: Microsoft’ PlayFab grows ninefold in 3 years
value.excerpt: Microsoft's PlayFab division said today that its monthly active users grew nearly nine times since the software giant acquired it.

value.title: Baidu gets California nod for testing empty self-driving cars
value.excerpt: Baidu Inc has received a permit from the state of California to test self-driving cars without a driver behind the wheel, the state's Department of Motor Vehicles said on Wednesday.

value.title: Nvidia shows off the first A100 GPU systems built to handle AI workloads
value.excerpt: As AI workloads can be complex and demanding, Nvidia has unveiled a new program that makes it easier for businesses to choose servers geared towards machine learning and analytics. This new class of accelerated servers from the company's partners are given the Nvidia-Certified Systems branding as they are designed to power organization's journeys into AI and data analytics.

value.title: Artificial Intelligence Is India’s Solution to Fix Data Gaps
value.excerpt: India is turning from man to machines to improve the quality and speed of its economic data, which has been criticized as inadequate, delayed or even confusing due to sharp and unexpected revisions.

value.title: New MIT brain research shows how AI could help us understand consciousness
value.excerpt: A team of researchers from MIT and Massachusetts General Hospital recently published a study linking social awareness to individual neuronal activity. To the best of our knowledge, this is the first time evidence for the ‘theory of mind‘ has been identified at this scale.

value.title: China growing use of emotion recognition tech raises rights concerns
value.excerpt: Technology that measures emotions based on biometric indicators such as facial movements, tone of voice or body movements, is increasingly being marketed in China, researchers say, despite concerns about its accuracy and wider human rights implications.
